echo ""
echo "Step 11: Creating and Merging CLAUDE.md Files"
echo "---------------------------------------------"

# Always create/replace the .apm/CLAUDE.md file
APM_CLAUDE_MD="$AP_ROOT/CLAUDE.md"
echo "Creating .apm/CLAUDE.md from template..."
replace_variables "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/CLAUDE.md.markdown.template" "$APM_CLAUDE_MD"
echo "‚úÖ Created: $APM_CLAUDE_MD"

# Handle the root project CLAUDE.md file with intelligent merge
ROOT_CLAUDE_MD="$PROJECT_ROOT/CLAUDE.md"
echo ""
echo "Handling root project CLAUDE.md file..."

# Set up merge system paths (use payload's own location, not deployed copy)
MERGE_SYSTEM="${INSTALLER_DIR}/claude-merge-system"
MERGE_ORCHESTRATOR="${MERGE_SYSTEM}/merge-orchestrator.sh"
TEMPLATE_FILE="${INSTALLER_DIR}/template.claude.md"

# Determine merge approach based on availability and user preference
USE_INTELLIGENT_MERGE=false
if [[ -f "$MERGE_ORCHESTRATOR" ]] && [[ -x "$MERGE_ORCHESTRATOR" ]]; then
    USE_INTELLIGENT_MERGE=true
fi

if [[ -f "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" ]]; then
    echo "Existing CLAUDE.md found."
    
    # Offer user choice if intelligent merge is available
    if [[ "$USE_INTELLIGENT_MERGE" = true ]] && [[ "$USE_DEFAULTS" != true ]]; then
        printf "${YELLOW}Use intelligent merge to preserve your customizations? (Y/n): ${NC}"
        safe_read MERGE_CHOICE
        MERGE_CHOICE="${MERGE_CHOICE:-Y}"
        
        if [[ ! "$MERGE_CHOICE" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
            USE_INTELLIGENT_MERGE=false
            echo "Using standard APM section merge instead."
        fi
    fi
    
    if [[ "$USE_INTELLIGENT_MERGE" = true ]]; then
        echo "Performing intelligent merge to preserve customizations..."
        
        # Create backup directory with timestamp
        BACKUP_DIR="${APM_ROOT}/backups/claude-md"
        BACKUP_TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
        mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
        
        # Create manual backup first
        cp "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" "${BACKUP_DIR}/CLAUDE.md.backup.${BACKUP_TIMESTAMP}"
        echo "  Created backup: ${BACKUP_DIR}/CLAUDE.md.backup.${BACKUP_TIMESTAMP}"
        
        # Run merge orchestrator with proper error handling
        MERGE_OUTPUT="${ROOT_CLAUDE_MD}.merged"
        MERGE_LOG="${BACKUP_DIR}/merge-${BACKUP_TIMESTAMP}.log"
        
        if "${MERGE_ORCHESTRATOR}" \
            --template "$TEMPLATE_FILE" \
            --user "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" \
            --output "$MERGE_OUTPUT" \
            --backup-dir "$BACKUP_DIR" \
            --strategy auto \
            --quiet 2>"$MERGE_LOG"; then
            
            # Success - verify output exists and has content
            if [[ -f "$MERGE_OUTPUT" ]] && [[ -s "$MERGE_OUTPUT" ]]; then
                # Check if custom sections were preserved
                CUSTOM_PRESERVED=true
                if [[ -f "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" ]]; then
                    # Simple check: see if file size increased (indicating merge worked)
                    ORIG_SIZE=$(stat -c%s "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
                    NEW_SIZE=$(stat -c%s "$MERGE_OUTPUT" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "$MERGE_OUTPUT" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
                    
                    if [[ $NEW_SIZE -lt $((ORIG_SIZE / 2)) ]]; then
                        CUSTOM_PRESERVED=false
                    fi
                fi
                
                if [[ "$CUSTOM_PRESERVED" = true ]]; then
                    mv "$MERGE_OUTPUT" "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
                    echo "‚úÖ CLAUDE.md successfully merged"
                    echo "  - Your customizations have been preserved"
                    echo "  - APM commands have been updated to latest version"
                    echo "  - Backup saved to: ${BACKUP_DIR}/"
                else
                    echo "‚ö† Merge completed but may have lost content. Using legacy method..."
                    rm -f "$MERGE_OUTPUT"
                    merge_apm_section "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
                fi
            else
                # Output file missing or empty
                echo "‚ö† Merge produced no output. Using legacy APM section merge..."
                rm -f "$MERGE_OUTPUT"
                merge_apm_section "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
            fi
        else
            # Merge command failed
            MERGE_EXIT_CODE=$?
            echo "‚ö† Intelligent merge encountered an issue (code: $MERGE_EXIT_CODE)."
            echo "  Using legacy APM section merge to ensure compatibility..."
            
            # Clean up failed merge output
            rm -f "$MERGE_OUTPUT"
            
            # Log details for debugging if needed
            if [[ -f "$MERGE_LOG" ]] && [[ -s "$MERGE_LOG" ]]; then
                echo "  (Details saved to: $MERGE_LOG)"
            fi
            
            # Use legacy method
            merge_apm_section "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
        fi
    else
        # Use legacy merge method
        echo "Using standard APM section merge..."
        merge_apm_section "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
    fi
else
    # No existing file - create from template
    echo "Creating new CLAUDE.md from template..."
    cp "$TEMPLATE_FILE" "$ROOT_CLAUDE_MD"
    echo "‚úÖ Created new CLAUDE.md"
    echo "  - Contains APM commands and project instructions"
    echo "  - You can customize this file with your own sections"
fi

echo ""
echo "Step 12: Configuring .gitignore"
echo "-------------------------------"

# Configure .gitignore
GITIGNORE_FILE="$PROJECT_ROOT/.gitignore"
if [ -f "$GITIGNORE_FILE" ]; then
    echo "Updating existing .gitignore file..."
    
    # Check if session notes entries already exist
    if ! grep -q "# Session notes" "$GITIGNORE_FILE"; then
        echo "" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "# Session notes (APM infrastructure)" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo ".apm/session_notes/" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo ".apm/rules/" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "# AP Mapping generated files" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo ".apm/CLAUDE.md" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "harmonization.log" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo "# Piper TTS installation (project-local)" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        echo ".piper/" >> "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
        
        echo "Added AP method entries to .gitignore"
    else
        echo ".gitignore already contains session notes entries"
    fi
else
    echo "Creating new .gitignore file..."
    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/gitignore.template" "$GITIGNORE_FILE"
    echo "Created .gitignore with AP method entries"
fi

# VERSION was already read from PAYLOAD_DIR at the beginning of the script
# No need to re-read it here

# Copy LICENSE and VERSION to .apm folder
if [ -f "$DIST_DIR/LICENSE" ]; then
    cp "$DIST_DIR/LICENSE" "$APM_ROOT/LICENSE"
    echo "Copied LICENSE to .apm folder"
fi

if [ -f "$DIST_DIR/VERSION" ]; then
    cp "$DIST_DIR/VERSION" "$APM_ROOT/VERSION"
    echo "Copied VERSION to .apm folder"
fi

echo ""
echo "Step 13: Validating Installation"
echo "--------------------------------"


# Obsidian integration removed - no additional configuration needed

# Test TTS if Piper was installed
if [ "$TTS_PROVIDER" = "piper" ] && [ -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/piper" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "Testing Piper TTS audio..."
    
    # Test audio playback with proper error handling
    if [ "$WAV_PLAYER" != "none" ]; then
        # Disable set -e for TTS testing to prevent installer crashes
        set +e
        
        TTS_TEST_SUCCESS=false
        
        # Use proper parameters for each audio player
        case "$WAV_PLAYER" in
            paplay)
                echo "Coherence, orchestrate your AI." | "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/piper" \
                    --model "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/models/en_US-ryan-medium.onnx" \
                    --output-raw 2>/dev/null | \
                    paplay --raw --rate=22050 --format=s16le --channels=1 2>/dev/null
                [ $? -eq 0 ] && TTS_TEST_SUCCESS=true
                ;;
            aplay)
                echo "Coherence, orchestrate your AI." | "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/piper" \
                    --model "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/models/en_US-ryan-medium.onnx" \
                    --output-raw 2>/dev/null | \
                    aplay -q -r 22050 -f S16_LE -t raw -c 1 - 2>/dev/null
                [ $? -eq 0 ] && TTS_TEST_SUCCESS=true
                ;;
            play)
                echo "Coherence, orchestrate your AI." | "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/piper" \
                    --model "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/models/en_US-ryan-medium.onnx" \
                    --output-raw 2>/dev/null | \
                    play -q -t raw -r 22050 -e signed -b 16 -c 1 - 2>/dev/null
                [ $? -eq 0 ] && TTS_TEST_SUCCESS=true
                ;;
            *)
                echo "Coherence, orchestrate your AI." | "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/piper" \
                    --model "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper/models/en_US-ryan-medium.onnx" \
                    --output-raw 2>/dev/null | \
                    $WAV_PLAYER $WAV_PLAYER_ARGS 2>/dev/null
                [ $? -eq 0 ] && TTS_TEST_SUCCESS=true
                ;;
        esac
        
        # Re-enable set -e
        set -e
        
        if [ "$TTS_TEST_SUCCESS" = true ]; then
            echo "‚úÖ Audio test successful!"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö† Audio test failed, but installation will continue.${NC}"
            echo "  TTS system is installed and functional, audio playback needs configuration:"
            echo "  - WSL2: Try 'pulseaudio --start' to restart audio"
            echo "  - Check audio devices: 'pactl info'"
            echo "  - Test manually: echo 'test' | /path/to/piper --model /path/to/model.onnx --output-raw | paplay --raw --rate=22050 --format=s16le --channels=1"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö† No audio player found for testing${NC}"
        echo "  TTS system is installed but no audio player available for playback"
    fi
fi

# Verify settings
echo ""
echo "Verifying configuration..."
if [ -f "$SETTINGS_FILE" ] && command -v jq >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    TTS_CHECK=$(jq -r '.env.TTS_PROVIDER // "none"' "$SETTINGS_FILE")
    AUDIO_CHECK=$(jq -r '.env.AUDIO_PLAYER // "none"' "$SETTINGS_FILE")
    WAV_CHECK=$(jq -r '.env.WAV_PLAYER // "none"' "$SETTINGS_FILE")
    NOTES_CHECK=$(jq -r '.env.NOTES_TYPE // "unknown"' "$SETTINGS_FILE")
    
    echo "- Session notes: $NOTES_CHECK"
    echo "- TTS provider: $TTS_CHECK"
    echo "- Audio player: $AUDIO_CHECK"
    echo "- WAV player: $WAV_CHECK"
    
    # Check for configuration mismatches
    NEEDS_FIX=false
    
    if [ "$TTS_PROVIDER" = "piper" ] && [ "$TTS_CHECK" != "piper" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}‚ö† WARNING: TTS provider mismatch! Expected 'piper', found '$TTS_CHECK'${NC}"
        NEEDS_FIX=true
    fi
    
    if [ "$AUDIO_PLAYER" != "none" ] && [ "$AUDIO_CHECK" = "none" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}‚ö† WARNING: Audio player not saved! Expected '$AUDIO_PLAYER', found 'none'${NC}"
        NEEDS_FIX=true
    fi
    
    if [ "$WAV_PLAYER" != "none" ] && [ "$WAV_CHECK" = "none" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}‚ö† WARNING: WAV player not saved! Expected '$WAV_PLAYER', found 'none'${NC}"
        NEEDS_FIX=true
    fi
    
    # Fix all issues if needed
    if [ "$NEEDS_FIX" = true ]; then
        echo "Fixing configuration..."
        tmp_file=$(mktemp)
        jq ".env.TTS_PROVIDER = \"$TTS_PROVIDER\" |
            .env.TTS_ENABLED = \"$([[ "$TTS_PROVIDER" != "none" ]] && echo "true" || echo "false")\" |
            .env.AUDIO_PLAYER = \"$AUDIO_PLAYER\" |
            .env.AUDIO_PLAYER_ARGS = \"$AUDIO_PLAYER_ARGS\" |
            .env.WAV_PLAYER = \"$WAV_PLAYER\" |
            .env.WAV_PLAYER_ARGS = \"$WAV_PLAYER_ARGS\"" "$SETTINGS_FILE" > "$tmp_file" && mv "$tmp_file" "$SETTINGS_FILE"
        echo "‚úÖ Configuration fixed"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "Step 14: Setting Up QA Framework Integration"
echo "--------------------------------------------"

# QA Framework commands are now installed via templates above
echo "‚úÖ QA Framework commands installed via templates"
echo ""
echo "Available QA Framework Commands:"
echo "- /qa-framework - Comprehensive QA Framework access"
echo "- /qa-predict - ML-powered test failure prediction"
echo "- /qa-optimize - Test execution optimization"
echo "- /qa-anomaly - Quality anomaly detection"
echo "- /qa-insights - AI-powered quality insights"

echo ""
echo "Step 15: Setting Up Test Monitoring Framework"
echo "----------------------------------------------"

# Create test monitoring infrastructure
echo "‚è≥ Installing test monitoring capabilities..."

# Create test monitoring directories
ensure_dir "$APM_ROOT/scripts/test-monitoring"

# Test monitoring scripts are installed via templates above
echo "‚úÖ Test monitoring scripts installed via templates"
echo ""
echo "Available Test Monitoring Commands:"
echo "- monitor tests - Real-time CLI test monitoring"
echo "- test dashboard - Web-based monitoring dashboard"
echo "- test metrics - Comprehensive metrics collection"
echo "- show test status - Quick test status overview"
echo ""
echo "Test Monitoring Features:"
echo "- Real-time process monitoring"
echo "- Web dashboard with auto-refresh"
echo "- Metrics collection and export (CSV, JSON, YAML)"
echo "- Integration with QA agent personas"
echo "- AI/ML analytics integration"
echo "- Notification system (TTS and webhooks)"


# Version file is already in place from earlier copy
# Just verify it exists
if [ -f "$APM_ROOT/VERSION" ]; then
    echo "Version file verified: $APM_ROOT/VERSION"
else
    # Fallback: Create version file if it wasn't copied
    echo "$VERSION" > "$APM_ROOT/VERSION"
    echo "Created version file: $APM_ROOT/VERSION"
fi

# Preserve ONLY essential files for ap-manager.sh updates
echo "Preserving essential update files..."
mkdir -p "$APM_ROOT/.payload"

# Copy only what ap-manager needs for updates
if [ -f "$INSTALLER_DIR/integrity-checker.sh" ]; then
    cp "$PAYLOAD_DIR/integrity-checker.sh" "$APM_ROOT/.payload/"
    chmod +x "$APM_ROOT/.payload/integrity-checker.sh"
fi

# Create a minimal templates backup for updates (not the entire templates directory)
mkdir -p "$APM_ROOT/.payload/templates"
# Just store version info for update compatibility checking
echo "$VERSION" > "$APM_ROOT/.payload/templates/VERSION"

echo "‚úÖ Preserved minimal files for ap-manager updates"

# Now clean up the rest of the payload
echo "Cleaning payload artifacts..."
# The full payload should not exist in the deployed project
# It creates confusion and agents read from wrong locations

# Change to project root before cleaning up
cd "$PROJECT_ROOT" 2>/dev/null || true

# Remove the tar.gz archive file from where it was extracted (next to installer directory)
EXTRACTION_DIR="$(dirname "$PAYLOAD_DIR")"
if [ -f "$EXTRACTION_DIR/coherence-v$VERSION-installer.tar.gz" ]; then
    rm -f "$EXTRACTION_DIR/coherence-v$VERSION-installer.tar.gz"
    echo "- Removed distribution archive"
fi

# Remove distribution files from project root (they're now in .apm folder)
if [ -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/LICENSE" ] && [ "$SKIP_COPY" != "true" ]; then
    rm -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/LICENSE"
    echo "- Removed LICENSE file from root (now in .apm folder)"
fi

if [ -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/VERSION" ]; then
    rm -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/VERSION"
    echo "- Removed VERSION file from root (now in .apm folder)"
fi

# Note: Distribution README is now placed in .apm directory to avoid overwriting user README
# Legacy cleanup for old installations that placed README in root
if [ -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/README.md" ] && grep -q "AP Mapping - Agentic Persona Mapping Framework" "$PROJECT_ROOT/README.md" 2>/dev/null; then
    rm -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/README.md"
    echo "- Removed legacy distribution README from root"
fi

# Clean up installer files from project root (simplified)
echo ""
echo "Cleaning up installer files..."

# Remove installer directory from project after installation
if [ "$SKIP_COPY" != "true" ]; then
    if [ -d "$PROJECT_ROOT/installer" ]; then
        rm -rf "$PROJECT_ROOT/installer"
        echo "- Removed installer directory from project root"
    fi
    # Also remove from distribution directory if different from project root
    if [ -d "$DIST_DIR/installer" ] && [ "$DIST_DIR" != "$PROJECT_ROOT" ]; then
        rm -rf "$DIST_DIR/installer"
        echo "- Removed installer directory from distribution"
    fi
fi

# Remove installer script from project root (but not if we're running from it)
installer_script="$PROJECT_ROOT/install.sh"
current_script="$(readlink -f "$0" 2>/dev/null || echo "$0")"
target_script="$(readlink -f "$installer_script" 2>/dev/null || echo "$installer_script")"

if [ -f "$installer_script" ] && [ "$current_script" != "$target_script" ]; then
    # Safe to remove directly - verify it's our installer
    if grep -q "AP Mapping Installation Script" "$installer_script" 2>/dev/null; then
        rm -f "$installer_script"
        echo "- Removed installer script from project root"
    fi
elif [ -f "$installer_script" ] && [ "$current_script" = "$target_script" ]; then
    echo "- Installer script will remain (currently executing from this location)"
    echo "  You can manually remove it after installation: rm install.sh"
fi

if [ "$USE_PLOPDOCK_MCP" = true ]; then
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}Plopdock MCP Integration Active:${NC}"
    echo "  ‚Ä¢ Dev server commands will be intercepted and managed"
    echo "  ‚Ä¢ Install Plopdock MCP: https://github.com/your-org/Plopdock"
    echo "  ‚Ä¢ Dashboard will be at: http://localhost:8080"
fi
echo ""
echo "Management commands:"
echo "- Check for updates: $AP_ROOT/scripts/ap-manager.sh update"
echo "- Verify installation: $AP_ROOT/scripts/ap-manager.sh verify"
echo "- Show version: $AP_ROOT/scripts/ap-manager.sh version"
echo ""
echo "For more information, see:"
echo "- Main instructions: $CLAUDE_MD"
echo "- Agents directory: $AP_ROOT"
echo ""
# Installation continues to final summary step

# Clean up payload directory after successful installation
echo ""
echo "Step 10: Cleanup"
echo "---------------"
if [ -d "$PAYLOAD_DIR" ] && [ "$PAYLOAD_DIR" != "$PROJECT_ROOT" ]; then
    # Check if we're running from within the payload directory
    current_dir="$(pwd)"
    script_dir="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    
    if [[ "$current_dir" == "$PAYLOAD_DIR"* ]] || [[ "$script_dir" == "$PAYLOAD_DIR"* ]]; then
        echo "- Distribution directory and archive will be removed after script completes"
        echo "  Creating cleanup script..."
        
        # Create a cleanup script that will run after install.sh exits
        cat > "$PROJECT_ROOT/cleanup_payload.sh" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Cleanup script to remove installer files after installation
sleep 2  # Wait for install.sh to fully exit

# Remove installer directory and files
if [ -d "installer" ]; then
    rm -rf installer
    echo "‚úÖ Installer directory removed"
fi

if [ -f "LICENSE" ]; then
    rm -f LICENSE
    echo "‚úÖ LICENSE file removed"
fi

if [ -f "VERSION" ]; then
    rm -f VERSION
    echo "‚úÖ VERSION file removed"
fi

# Remove any tar.gz files in current directory that match coherence pattern
for file in coherence-v*.tar.gz; do
    if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        rm -f "$file"
        echo "‚úÖ Distribution archive removed: $file"
    fi
done

# Remove this cleanup script
rm -f "$0"
EOF
        chmod +x "$PROJECT_ROOT/cleanup_payload.sh"
        
        # Schedule the cleanup to run in background after install.sh exits
        (nohup bash "$PROJECT_ROOT/cleanup_payload.sh" > /dev/null 2>&1 &)
        echo "‚úÖ Cleanup scheduled"
    else
        # Safe to remove directly - we're not running from within payload
        PARENT_DIR="$(dirname "$PAYLOAD_DIR")"
        cd "$PARENT_DIR"
        
        # Remove installer directory and files
        if [ -d "installer" ]; then
            rm -rf installer
            echo "‚úÖ Installer directory removed"
        fi
        
        if [ -f "LICENSE" ]; then
            rm -f LICENSE
            echo "‚úÖ LICENSE file removed"
        fi
        
        if [ -f "VERSION" ]; then
            rm -f VERSION
            echo "‚úÖ VERSION file removed"
        fi
        
        # Remove any tar.gz files that match coherence pattern
        for file in coherence-v*.tar.gz; do
            if [ -f "$file" ]; then
                rm -f "$file"
                echo "‚úÖ Distribution archive removed: $file"
            fi
        done
        
        log_install "Installation files cleaned up" "INFO"
    fi
else
    echo "- No cleanup needed (payload directory not found or is project root)"
fi

# Final validation to catch common script errors
echo ""
echo "Step 16: Final Installation Validation"
echo "-------------------------------------"

# Function to validate generated scripts for common typos
validate_generated_scripts() {
    local validation_failed=false
    local validation_temp_file="/tmp/planning-validation_results.$$"
    
    echo "‚è≥ Validating generated scripts..."
    
    # Check for common typos in shell scripts
    local script_dirs=(
        "$CLAUDE_DIR"
        "$APM_ROOT/agents/scripts"
        "$PROJECT_ROOT/.piper"
        "$PROJECT_ROOT"  # Also check project root for any generated scripts
    )
    
    for dir in "${script_dirs[@]}"; do
        if [ -d "$dir" ]; then
            echo "  Checking directory: $dir"
            # Look for shell scripts with common typos - fix subshell issue
            local script_files
            script_files=$(find "$dir" -maxdepth 2 -name "*.sh" -type f 2>/dev/null)
            
            for script_file in $script_files; do
                if [ -f "$script_file" ]; then
                    echo "    Validating: $script_file"
                    
                    # Check for command typos - FAIL if found, do NOT auto-fix
                    local typos=("^cho$" "^cho " "^[[:space:]]*Wait[[:space:]]" "^ech " "^ecoh " "^ehco " "^wiat" "^Wiat" "^WAIT")
                    for typo in "${typos[@]}"; do
                        if grep -q "$typo" "$script_file" 2>/dev/null && ! grep -q "^[[:space:]]*#.*$(echo "$typo" | sed 's/\^//g; s/\[[^]]*\]//g')" "$script_file" 2>/dev/null; then
                            echo "‚ùå CRITICAL ERROR: Found command typo in $script_file"
                            echo "   Pattern: $typo"
                            echo "   This indicates a quality control failure in source code"
                            echo "   Installation cannot continue with corrupted scripts"
                            validation_failed=true
                        fi
                    done
                fi
            done
        fi
    done
    
    # Final validation check - FAIL if any errors found
    if [ "$validation_failed" = true ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "‚ùå INSTALLATION ABORTED - QUALITY CONTROL FAILURE"
        echo "   Script validation failed due to command typos in source code"
        echo "   This indicates corrupted or poorly tested distribution"
        echo "   Please report this issue and do not use this installer"
        echo ""
        exit 1
    else
        echo "‚úÖ Script validation passed - no command typos found"
    fi
    
    # Clean up temp files
    rm -f "$validation_temp_file" 2>/dev/null
}

# Run validation
validate_generated_scripts

echo ""
echo "Step 17: Installation Summary"
echo "----------------------------"

# Display final installation summary
echo "==========================================
Coherence installation completed!
==========================================

Installation Summary:
- Version: $VERSION (Native Sub-Agent Architecture)
- Location: $PROJECT_ROOT
- Project: $PROJECT_NAME

Version file verified: $APM_ROOT/VERSION"

# Display preserved files info
if [ -f "$APM_ROOT/ap-manager.sh" ]; then
    echo "Preserving essential update files..."
    echo "‚úÖ Preserved minimal files for ap-manager updates"
fi

echo "Cleaning payload artifacts..."
if [ -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/LICENSE" ] && [ -f "$APM_ROOT/LICENSE" ]; then
    rm -f "$PROJECT_ROOT/LICENSE" 2>/dev/null
    echo "- Removed LICENSE file from root (now in .apm folder)"
fi

# Display next steps in blue at the very end
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}Next steps:${NC}"
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}1. Open the project in Claude Code${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}2. Try running: /ap${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}3. Test QA Framework: /qa-framework${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}4. Explore AI/ML commands: /qa-predict, /qa-optimize, /qa-anomaly, /qa-insights${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}5. Organize documentation: /doc-compliance organize --dry-run${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}6. Check out the documentation at: .apm/documentation/ (Main index: .apm/README.md)${NC}"

}

# Execute installation with appropriate display mode
if [ "$USE_LIVE_MODE" = true ] && [ "$LIVE_DISPLAY_AVAILABLE" = true ]; then
    # Run with COHERENCE fixed banner at top
    run_with_fixed_banner "main_installation_process"
else
    # Run directly without live tracking
    if [ "$LIVE_DISPLAY_AVAILABLE" = false ] && [ "$USE_LIVE_MODE" = true ]; then
        echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  COHERENCE banner script not found. Running standard installation."
        echo ""
    fi
    main_installation_process
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Build script for creating AP Mapping distribution package
# This creates a versioned tar.gz file with all necessary components

set -e

# Configuration
# Read version from VERSION file if it exists
if [ -f "templates/VERSION" ]; then
    VERSION=$(cat templates/VERSION)
elif [ -f "VERSION" ]; then
    VERSION=$(cat VERSION)
else
    VERSION="4.3.0"
fi
DIST_NAME="coherence-v$VERSION-installer"
DIST_DIR="dist/$DIST_NAME"

echo "=========================================="
echo "Building AP Mapping Distribution v$VERSION"
echo "=========================================="
echo ""

# Clean previous builds
echo "Cleaning previous builds..."
if [ -d "dist" ]; then
    # Remove contents of dist directory but keep the directory itself
    rm -rf dist/*
    # Also clean any hidden directories like .apm (but not . and ..)
    find dist -name ".*" -not -name "." -not -name ".." -exec rm -rf {} + 2>/dev/null || true
else
    # Create dist directory if it doesn't exist
    mkdir -p dist
fi

# Create distribution directory
echo "Creating distribution structure..."
mkdir -p "$DIST_DIR"

# Generate persona templates from JSON master definitions
echo "Generating persona templates from JSON definitions..."
if [ -f "payload/generate-personas.sh" ]; then
    echo "Running production persona generation..."
    (cd payload && bash generate-personas.sh)
    echo "‚úÖ Persona templates verified from JSON master definitions"
elif [ -f "payload/simple-persona-generator.sh" ]; then
    echo "Running simple persona generation..."
    (cd payload && bash simple-persona-generator.sh)
    echo "‚úÖ Persona templates generated (simple mode)"
else
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Persona generator not found, using existing templates"
fi

# Validate template system integrity
echo "Validating template system integrity..."
# Check if payload/templates directory exists in distribution
if [ -d "payload/templates" ]; then
    TEMPLATE_COUNT=$(find payload/templates -name "*.template" -type f | wc -l)
else
    echo "‚ùå ERROR: payload/templates directory not found"
    exit 1
fi

if [ "$TEMPLATE_COUNT" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "‚ùå ERROR: No template files found"
    exit 1
else
    echo "‚úÖ Template system validation passed: $TEMPLATE_COUNT templates ready for distribution"
fi

# No cleanup needed - only templates and installer files in distribution
echo "No cleanup needed for template-only distribution"

# Note: Hook scripts are now in templates/templates/hooks as Python files
# The old agents/hooks directory has been removed

# No git files to remove - only templates and installer in distribution

# Copy payload directory (rename to installer in distribution)
echo "Copying payload directory as installer..."
# Use rsync to exclude node_modules and MCP Debug Host files
rsync -av --exclude='node_modules' --exclude='*.log' --exclude='.git' --exclude='coverage' --exclude='test-reports' --exclude='templates/docs/debug-host-mcp-integration.md.template' payload/ "$DIST_DIR/installer/"

# Create VERSION file at root level
echo "$VERSION" > "$DIST_DIR/VERSION"

# Create LICENSE file at root level  
echo "Creating LICENSE file..."
cat > "$DIST_DIR/LICENSE" << 'EOF'
MIT License

Copyright (c) 2024 AP Mapping Contributors

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

# Production Persona Generation System

VERSION=$(cat "$SCRIPT_DIR/VERSION" 2>/dev/null || echo "4.3.0")

# Output directories
APM_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/agents/personas"
CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/claude/agents/personas"

# Colors
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'

echo "" >&1

# Create output directories
mkdir -p "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR"
mkdir -p "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR"

# Track results
SUCCESS_COUNT=0
TOTAL_COUNT=0

# Process each persona JSON file
for persona_file in "$PERSONAS_DIR"/*.persona.json; do
    if [ ! -f "$persona_file" ]; then
        continue
    fi
    
    persona_name=$(basename "$persona_file" .persona.json)
    TOTAL_COUNT=$((TOTAL_COUNT + 1))
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Processing $persona_name...${NC}"
    
    # For production, we'll copy existing templates for now
    # This ensures the build process works while we enhance generation
    
    # Check for existing APM template
    if [ -f "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/${persona_name}.md.template" ]; then
        echo -e "  ${GREEN}‚úì${NC} APM template exists: ${persona_name}.md.template"
        SUCCESS_COUNT=$((SUCCESS_COUNT + 1))
    else
        # Try to find template in backup locations
        if [ -f "$TEMPLATES_DIR/personas/${persona_name}.md.template" ]; then
            cp "$TEMPLATES_DIR/personas/${persona_name}.md.template" "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/"
            echo -e "  ${GREEN}‚úì${NC} Copied APM template from personas/"
            SUCCESS_COUNT=$((SUCCESS_COUNT + 1))
        else
            echo -e "  ${YELLOW}‚ö†${NC} No APM template found for $persona_name"
        fi
    fi
    
    # Check for Claude template
    claude_name="$persona_name"
    if [ "$persona_name" = "dev" ]; then
        claude_name="developer"
    fi
    
    if [ -f "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/${claude_name}.md.template" ]; then
        echo -e "  ${GREEN}‚úì${NC} Claude template exists: ${claude_name}.md.template"
        SUCCESS_COUNT=$((SUCCESS_COUNT + 1))
    else
        echo -e "  ${YELLOW}‚ö†${NC} No Claude template found for $claude_name"
    fi
    
    echo ""

#!/bin/bash
# Unified Persona Generation System
# Generates both APM and Claude persona templates from single JSON source

set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PERSONAS_DIR="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
MASTER_DIR="$PERSONAS_DIR/_master"
INSTALLER_DIR="$(dirname "$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")")"
TEMPLATES_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/templates"

# Output directories
APM_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/agents/personas"
CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/claude/agents/personas"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# We'll implement our own simple template replacement for now
# The existing template processor expects specific arguments we don't need

# Helper function to extract JSON value
get_json_value() {
    local json_file="$1"
    local json_path="$2"
    
    if command -v jq &> /dev/null; then
        jq -r "$json_path" "$json_file"
    else
        # Fallback to basic parsing if jq not available
        grep "\"${json_path##*.}\":" "$json_file" | head -1 | cut -d'"' -f4
    fi
}

# Generate APM persona template
generate_apm_template() {
    local persona_json="$1"

    local output_file="$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/${persona_id}.md.template"
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Generating APM template for ${persona_id}...${NC}"

    {
        # Role definition

üéØ ### PERSONA SYSTEM ANALYSIS - COMPLETE ‚úÖ

===== INVESTIGATION RESULTS =====
‚úÖ Examined build-distribution.sh persona generation process ‚Äî Complete
‚úÖ Analyzed relationship between _master/, _build/, and templates/ ‚Äî Complete  
‚úÖ Determined which persona files are needed ‚Äî Complete
‚úÖ Identified cleanup opportunities ‚Äî Complete

---

## üîç **COMPREHENSIVE PERSONA SYSTEM ANALYSIS REPORT**

### üìä **Current Persona System Overview**

I've discovered a **complex multi-layered persona generation system** with overlapping components:

#### **üóÇÔ∏è Directory Structure Analysis**
1. **`payload/personas/_master/` (9 JSON files)** - ‚úÖ **PRIMARY SOURCE** 
   - Master persona definitions in JSON format
   - Single source of truth for all persona metadata
   - Example: `analyst.persona.json`, `architect.persona.json`, etc.

2. **`payload/personas/_build/` (2 scripts)** - ‚ö†Ô∏è **UNUSED GENERATORS**
   - `generate-personas.sh` - Complete template generator from JSON
   - `generate-personas-v2.sh` - Advanced generator  
   - **Status**: NOT CALLED by build system

3. **`payload/templates/agents/personas/` (19 files)** - ‚ö†Ô∏è **MIXED CONTENT**
   - Contains 11 actual persona templates 
   - Contains 8 non-persona documentation files
   - **Status**: Some files are needed, others are orphaned docs

4. **`payload/templates/claude/agents/personas/` (9 files)** - ‚úÖ **CLEAN**
   - Contains exactly 9 persona templates matching JSON definitions
   - **Status**: Correctly maintained

### üîß **How The Build System Actually Works**

#### **Current Build Process** (`build-distribution.sh` ‚Üí `generate-personas.sh`):
1. Calls `payload/generate-personas.sh` (NOT the `_build/` scripts)
2. **Does NOT generate** - only **validates existing templates**
3. Reports: "Templates verified: X" (checking, not creating)

#### **The Hidden Truth**:
```bash
# From generate-personas.sh lines 49-50:
# "For production, we'll copy existing templates for now" 
# "This ensures the build process works while we enhance generation"
```

**Translation**: The system was designed to generate templates from JSON but currently just validates pre-existing template files.

---

## üö® **KEY FINDINGS**

### 1. **Templates Are Source Files, NOT Generated Files**
- The `templates/agents/personas/` files are **manually maintained source files**
- They are NOT generated from the JSON definitions during build
- The JSON definitions are **currently unused** in the build process

### 2. **Orphaned Generation System**  
- The `_build/` directory contains sophisticated generators that **are never called**
- These generators could create templates from JSON but are bypassed
- The build system uses a simplified validator instead

### 3. **Mixed Content in APM Personas Directory**
The `templates/agents/personas/` directory contains **two types of files**:

#### ‚úÖ **Actual Persona Templates** (11 files needed):
- `analyst.md.template`, `architect.md.template`, `designer.md.template`
- `developer.md.template`, `dev.md.template`, `orchestrator.md.template`
- `pm.md.template`, `po.md.template`, `qa.md.template`
- `analyst-demo.md.template`, `ap_orchestrator.md.template`

#### ‚ùå **Non-Persona Documentation** (8 files - orphaned):
- `MIGRATION-PATTERNS-ANALYSIS.md.template`
- `PERFORMANCE-MEASUREMENT-FRAMEWORK.md.template`
- `PERSONA-UPDATE-TEMPLATE.md.template`  
- `STORY-17.10-IMPLEMENTATION-GUIDE.md.template`
- `communication_standards.md.template`
- `analyze-test-results.md.template`
- `generate-test-plan.md.template`
- `optimize-test-plan.md.template`

---

## üìã **RECOMMENDATIONS**

### üî• **Immediate Cleanup (High Priority)**

#### **1. Remove Non-Persona Files from Personas Directory**
```bash
# Remove documentation files that don't belong in personas directory
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/MIGRATION-PATTERNS-ANALYSIS.md.template
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/PERFORMANCE-MEASUREMENT-FRAMEWORK.md.template  
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/PERSONA-UPDATE-TEMPLATE.md.template
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/STORY-17.10-IMPLEMENTATION-GUIDE.md.template
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/communication_standards.md.template
```

#### **2. Remove QA Command Templates from Personas Directory**  
```bash
# These should be in commands directory, not personas
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/analyze-test-results.md.template
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/generate-test-plan.md.template  
rm /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/templates/agents/personas/optimize-test-plan.md.template
```

### üí° **System Optimization (Medium Priority)**

#### **3. Decision on Generation System**

**Option A: Keep Current Manual System**
- Keep `templates/agents/personas/` as source files
- Remove unused `_build/` and `_master/` directories  
- Simplify to single-source system

**Option B: Activate JSON Generation System**
- Fix build system to actually use `_build/` generators
- Generate templates from `_master/` JSON during build
- Treat templates as build artifacts, not source

**Recommendation**: **Option A** - Keep current manual system since it's working and simpler.

#### **4. Remove Unused Generation Infrastructure**
If keeping manual system:
```bash
# Remove unused generation infrastructure
rm -rf /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/personas/_build/
rm -rf /mnt/c/Code/agentic-persona-mapping/payload/personas/_master/  
# Keep only the working templates in templates/agents/personas/
```

---

## üìä **Expected Benefits**

### **File Reduction**
- **Remove 8 orphaned docs** from personas directory
- **Remove 11 unused generation files** (_build/ + _master/)
- **Total reduction**: 19 files, ~100KB

### **System Clarity**  
- **Clear separation**: Personas contain only persona templates
- **Simplified maintenance**: One source of truth for templates
- **Reduced confusion**: No unused generation system

### **Build Process**
- **Faster validation**: Fewer files to check
- **Cleaner structure**: Each directory has single purpose  
- **Better maintainability**: Clear file organization

---

## üéØ **FINAL RECOMMENDATION**

### **For Current Iteration**: 
**KEEP the manual template system** - it's working perfectly and the build process completed successfully with it.

### **Immediate Action**: 
**REMOVE the 8 orphaned documentation files** from the personas directory - they don't belong there and create confusion.

### **Future Consideration**:
The JSON generation system in `_build/` and `_master/` is sophisticated but unused. Consider removing this unused infrastructure to simplify the codebase.

---

**Status**: ‚úÖ **Analysis Complete** - Ready to execute cleanup if desired

The current persona system is functional but has accumulated extra files over time. The core system works well - it just needs some cleanup to remove files that don't belong in the personas directory.

## üîç **DEFINITIVE ANSWER**: NO - They Are Completely Different! ‚ùå

### üìä **Comparison Results**

**Subagent templates** and **persona templates** are **NOT the same** - they are completely different systems serving distinct purposes:

---

## üÜö **KEY DIFFERENCES**

### **1. Claude Subagent Templates** (`/templates/claude/agents/personas/`)
- **Purpose**: Templates for Claude Code native sub-agents
- **Format**: Modern template format with HTML-style comments
- **Features**: Native sub-agent coordination, enterprise features  
- **Target**: Claude Code IDE integration
- **File Count**: 9 files
- **Average Size**: ~4,200 bytes per file

### **2. APM Persona Templates** (`/templates/agents/personas/`)  
- **Purpose**: Templates for traditional APM persona agents
- **Format**: Traditional markdown format with detailed initialization
- **Features**: Working directory verification, path validation, session management
- **Target**: APM framework (.apm/agents/personas/)
- **File Count**: 19 files (11 actual personas + 8 docs)
- **Average Size**: ~4,100 bytes per file

---

## üìã **Detailed Evidence**

### **File Content Analysis**

#### **Subagent Template Example** (`claude/agents/personas/analyst.md.template`):
```markdown
<!-- APM Analyst Agent Template - A Brainstorming BA and RA Expert -->
<!-- Template Version: {{MIGRATION_VERSION}} -->
<!-- Agent: {{AGENT_NAME}} -->

## üìä Template Metadata
- **Agent Type**: A Brainstorming BA and RA Expert
- **Template Version**: {{MIGRATION_VERSION}}
- **Enterprise Features**: Native sub-agent parallel execution
```

#### **Persona Template Example** (`agents/personas/analyst.md.template`):
```markdown
# Role: Analyst Agent

### WORKING DIRECTORY VERIFICATION
**CRITICAL**: Before ANY file operation, verify working directory:
cd {{PROJECT_ROOT}}
pwd  # Should show: /path/to/your/project
```

### **Structure Differences**

| Feature | Subagent Templates | Persona Templates |
|---------|-------------------|------------------|
| **Header Format** | HTML comments with metadata | Simple markdown titles |
| **Initialization** | Native sub-agent coordination | Detailed step-by-step sequence |
| **Path Handling** | Template variables | Explicit path validation |
| **Target System** | Claude Code | APM Framework |
| **Content Length** | ~100 lines | ~90-150 lines |

---

## üéØ **What This Means**

### **‚úÖ Both Systems Are Needed**
1. **Subagent Templates**: Used by installer to create `.claude/agents/personas/`
2. **Persona Templates**: Used by installer to create `.apm/agents/personas/`

### **‚úÖ No Duplication Issues**
- They serve completely different purposes
- They install to different locations
- They have different content and functionality

### **‚úÖ System Architecture**
```
Build Process:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ templates/claude/agents/personas/ ‚Üí .claude/agents/personas/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ templates/agents/personas/ ‚Üí .apm/agents/personas/
```

---

## üìå **Final Recommendation**

**KEEP BOTH SYSTEMS** - They are not duplicates but rather:

1. **Different deployment targets** (Claude Code vs APM Framework)
2. **Different feature sets** (native sub-agents vs traditional personas)  
3. **Different initialization patterns** (modern vs traditional)
4. **Different use cases** (IDE integration vs framework personas)

The only cleanup needed is removing the **8 non-persona documentation files** from the APM personas directory, but the core persona templates in both locations are essential and serve distinct purposes.

---

**Status**: ‚úÖ **Question Answered Definitively**

**Subagent templates ‚â† Persona templates** - They are complementary systems, not duplicates.

#!/bin/bash
# Unified Persona Generation System
# Generates both APM and Claude persona templates from single JSON source

set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PERSONAS_DIR="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
MASTER_DIR="$PERSONAS_DIR/_master"
INSTALLER_DIR="$(dirname "$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")")"
TEMPLATES_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/templates"

# Output directories
APM_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/agents/personas"
CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/claude/agents/personas"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# We'll implement our own simple template replacement for now
# The existing template processor expects specific arguments we don't need

# Helper function to extract JSON value
get_json_value() {
    local json_file="$1"
    local json_path="$2"
    
    if command -v jq &> /dev/null; then
        jq -r "$json_path" "$json_file"
    else
        # Fallback to basic parsing if jq not available
        grep "\"${json_path##*.}\":" "$json_file" | head -1 | cut -d'"' -f4
    fi
}

# Generate APM persona template
generate_apm_template() {
    local persona_json="$1"
    local persona_id=$(get_json_value "$persona_json" '.metadata.id')
    local output_file="$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/${persona_id}.md.template"
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Generating APM template for ${persona_id}...${NC}"
    
    # Start with content sections
    {
        # Role definition
        get_json_value "$persona_json" '.content_sections.role_definition'
        echo ""
        
        # Critical header
        get_json_value "$persona_json" '.content_sections.critical_header'
        echo ""
        
        # Research protocols if analyst
        if [ "$persona_id" = "analyst" ]; then
            get_json_value "$persona_json" '.content_sections.research_protocols'
            echo ""
            
            # Add mandatory research sequence
            echo "### üìã MANDATORY RESEARCH SEQUENCE:"
            echo "1. **Search Project Docs**: Check {{PROJECT_ROOT}}/project_docs/ and {{SESSION_NOTES_PATH}}/"
            echo "2. **Search Codebase**: Use Grep/Glob tools to find existing implementations"
            echo "3. **Read Configurations**: Examine actual files, logs, and configurations"
            echo "4. **Research Externally**: Use WebSearch for authoritative sources when needed"
            echo "5. **Ask for Clarification**: Stop and ask specific questions when uncertain"
            echo ""
            
            # Add forbidden behaviors
            echo "### ‚ùå FORBIDDEN BEHAVIORS:"
            echo "- **Never say**: \"I assume...\", \"Probably...\", \"It should be...\", \"Typically...\""
            echo "- **Never guess** at: API endpoints, file paths, configuration values, requirements"
            echo "- **Never invent**: Technical specifications, user requirements, system constraints"
            echo ""
            
            # Add required evidence statements
            echo "### ‚úÖ REQUIRED EVIDENCE STATEMENTS:"
            echo "- \"According to [specific file/source]...\""
            echo "- \"The existing code in [path] shows...\""
            echo "- \"Based on my search of [location], I found...\""
            echo "- \"I need clarification on [specific aspect] because [context]\""
            echo ""
            
            # Add escalation triggers
            echo "### üö® ESCALATION TRIGGERS - Stop and ask when:"
            echo "- Conflicting information found in different sources"
            echo "- Missing critical documentation or requirements"
            echo "- Ambiguous user requirements despite research"
            echo "- Security or data integrity implications discovered"
            echo ""
            echo "**Remember**: Better to ask one clarifying question than make ten wrong assumptions."
            echo ""
            echo "**Full protocols**: See {{AP_ROOT}}/docs/CRITICAL-RESEARCH-PROTOCOLS.md"
            echo ""
        fi
        
        # Voice notification section

#!/bin/bash
# Unified Persona Generation System V2
# Generates both APM and Claude persona templates from single JSON source

set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PERSONAS_DIR="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
MASTER_DIR="$PERSONAS_DIR/_master"
INSTALLER_DIR="$(dirname "$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")")"
TEMPLATES_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/templates"

# Output directories
APM_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/agents/personas"
CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR="$TEMPLATES_DIR/claude/agents/personas"

# Colors
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}   Unified Persona Generation System V2${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo ""

# Create output directories
mkdir -p "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR"
mkdir -p "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR"

# Process analyst persona
PERSONA_FILE="$MASTER_DIR/analyst.persona.json"

if [ ! -f "$PERSONA_FILE" ]; then
    echo "Error: Persona file not found: $PERSONA_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${YELLOW}Processing analyst persona...${NC}"

# For now, we'll just copy the existing templates as a proof of concept
# In production, this would generate from the JSON

# Check if we have existing templates to compare against
EXISTING_APM="$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template.backup"
EXISTING_CLAUDE="$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template.backup"

# Create backups of existing files
if [ -f "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template" ]; then
    cp "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template" "$EXISTING_APM"
    echo "Backed up existing APM template"
fi

if [ -f "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template" ]; then
    cp "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template" "$EXISTING_CLAUDE"
    echo "Backed up existing Claude template"
fi

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Generation complete!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Next steps:"
echo "1. The JSON master definition is in: $PERSONA_FILE"
echo "2. Generated templates would go to:"
echo "   - APM: $APM_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template"
echo "   - Claude: $CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/analyst.md.template"
echo "3. Full implementation would parse JSON and generate both formats"
echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}Proof of Concept: Single source ‚Üí Dual output${NC}"

"For production, we'll copy existing templates for now

# APM Persona Generation System

This directory contains the enhanced persona generation system for the APM (Agentic Persona Mapping) framework.

## üöÄ Quick Start

Run the production-ready generator:

```bash
cd installer
./simple-persona-generator.sh
```

## üìÅ Directory Structure

```
personas/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md                          # This file
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _master/                           # JSON master definitions (single source of truth)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ analyst.persona.json          # Analyst agent definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ architect.persona.json        # Architect agent definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ designer.persona.json # Designer definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ developer.persona.json        # Developer agent definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ orchestrator.persona.json     # AP Orchestrator definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pm.persona.json               # Project Manager definition
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ po.persona.json               # Product Owner definition (enhanced with agile coordination)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ qa.persona.json               # QA Engineer definition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _templates/                        # Template base files
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ apm.persona.template          # APM deployment template
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ claude.persona.template       # Claude Code template
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _tools/                           # Generation utilities
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ generate-personas.sh          # Original generator
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ _build/                          # Generated output (gitignored)
```

## üîß Generation Scripts

### 1. Simple Persona Generator (Recommended)
- **Script**: `simple-persona-generator.sh`
- **Purpose**: Fast, reliable generation of all 8 personas
- **Output**: Both APM and Claude templates
- **Features**: 
  - JSON-based configuration reading
  - Comprehensive template structure
  - Error handling and validation

### 2. Enhanced Persona Generator (Advanced)
- **Script**: `enhanced-persona-generator.sh`
- **Purpose**: Advanced generation with extensive customization
- **Features**: 
  - Complex template processing
  - Persona-specific capability mapping
  - Advanced error handling

### 3. Production Persona Generator (Development)
- **Script**: `production-persona-generator.sh`
- **Purpose**: Production-ready with extensive logging
- **Status**: Development (may hang in complex cases)

## üéØ Persona Definitions

All 8 APM personas are defined as JSON master files:

### Core Personas
1. **Analyst** - Brainstorming BA and RA Expert
2. **Architect** - System Architecture and Technical Design Expert  
3. **Designer** - UI/UX and Design Systems Expert
4. **Developer** - Full-Stack Development Expert
5. **Project Manager** - Project Planning and Execution Expert
6. **Product Owner** - Product Strategy, Backlog Management & Agile Coordination Expert
7. **QA Engineer** - Quality Assurance and Testing Expert

### Central Coordinator
8. **AP Orchestrator** - Central Coordination and Delegation Hub

## üìù JSON Master Definition Structure

Each persona is defined with:

```json

content.thinking: Now I have all the information I need to provide a comprehensive report on why the Generate Personas system was never put into practice.

content.text:
## üîç **WHY THE GENERATE PERSONAS SYSTEM WAS NEVER IMPLEMENTED**

### **üìä Investigation Summary**

I've conducted a comprehensive analysis of the intended Generate Personas system, and the evidence reveals a **sophisticated vision that was never fully realized** due to specific technical and practical constraints.

---

## üéØ **THE ORIGINAL VISION**

### **üèóÔ∏è Intended Architecture**
The Generate Personas system was designed as an **extremely ambitious single-source-of-truth system**:

1. **JSON Master Definitions** (`personas/_master/`) - Complete persona specifications
2. **Template Engine** (`personas/_templates/`) - Jinja2-style templates for both outputs  
3. **Generation Scripts** (`personas/_build/`) - Sophisticated processors
4. **Dual Output System** - Generate both APM and Claude templates from single source

### **üìã Comprehensive JSON Specification**
Each persona was defined with **131 lines of structured JSON** including:
- **Metadata & Configuration**: Version, compatibility, paths
- **Behavioral Rules**: Research protocols, escalation triggers  
- **Initialization Sequences**: Step-by-step activation procedures
- **Deployment Targets**: Separate configs for APM vs Claude
- **Content Sections**: Structured template content blocks

### **üîß Sophisticated Templates**
The base templates used **Jinja2-style templating**:
```markdown
# Role: ${persona.name} - ${persona.role}
{% for step in initialization.apm_sequence -%}
${loop.index}. **${step.action}**: ${step.command}
{% endfor %}
```

---

## ‚ùå **WHY IT WAS NEVER IMPLEMENTED**

### **üî¥ PRIMARY REASON: Missing Templating Engine**

**Critical Evidence** from `personas/_tools/generate-personas.sh` lines 51-52:
```bash
# This is a simplified version - in practice, we'd use a proper template engine
# like Jinja2 or a custom processor that can handle the YAML structure
```

**The fundamental blocker**: They designed sophisticated templates requiring **Jinja2 or similar templating engine**, but never implemented the template processing system.

### **üî¥ SECONDARY REASONS:**

#### **1. Complexity Overwhelm**
- **131-line JSON definitions** for each persona
- **Advanced templating syntax** with loops, conditionals, filters
- **Dual-target generation** (APM vs Claude) with different feature sets
- **Complex initialization sequences** with 5+ steps per persona

#### **2. Time Pressure & Pragmatism**
**Evidence** from `generate-personas.sh` lines 49-50:
```bash
# For production, we'll copy existing templates for now
# This ensures the build process works while we enhance generation
```

They chose **pragmatic fallback** to keep the system working while planning to enhance it later.

#### **3. Script Evolution Shows Retreat**
- **`_build/generate-personas.sh`**: Full implementation attempt with JSON parsing
- **`_build/generate-personas-v2.sh`**: Reduced to "proof of concept" that just copies files  
- **`generate-personas.sh`**: Final fallback that just validates existing templates

#### **4. Incomplete Tooling**
The bash scripts attempted to:
- Parse complex JSON with basic `jq` commands
- Implement template processing manually  
- Handle dual-target generation without proper framework

---

## üî¨ **SPECIFIC TECHNICAL EVIDENCE**

### **Attempted Implementation Traces**

#### **In `_build/generate-personas.sh`**:
```bash
# We'll implement our own simple template replacement for now
# The existing template processor expects specific arguments we don't need
```
**Translation**: They tried to build custom template processing but hit complexity limits.

#### **In `_build/generate-personas-v2.sh`**:
```bash
# For now, we'll just copy the existing templates as a proof of concept
# In production, this would generate from the JSON
```
**Translation**: They backed down to proof-of-concept after realizing implementation complexity.

### **What They Actually Built vs. What They Intended**

| Component | **Intended** | **Actually Built** |
|-----------|-------------|------------------|
| **Template Processing** | Jinja2-style engine | Basic bash string replacement |
| **JSON Parsing** | Full object processing | Simple `jq` value extraction |
| **Content Generation** | Template-driven | Hard-coded string concatenation |
| **Dual Output** | Single source ‚Üí Two formats | Two separate template directories |
| **Build Integration** | Automatic generation | Manual template validation |

---

## üìà **THE TECHNICAL DEBT SPIRAL**

### **Phase 1: Ambitious Design** (JSON + Templates)
- Created comprehensive JSON specifications  
- Designed sophisticated template system
- Planned dual-target generation

### **Phase 2: Implementation Struggles** (Bash Limitations)  
- Bash proved inadequate for complex template processing
- JSON parsing became unwieldy  
- Dual-target logic grew complex

### **Phase 3: Pragmatic Retreat** (Manual Templates)
- Fell back to manual template creation
- Keep JSON definitions "for future use"
- Build system validates instead of generates

### **Phase 4: Current State** (Legacy System)
- JSON definitions are unused but maintained
- Templates are manually created and maintained
- Generation system exists but isn't called by build

---

## üéØ **ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS**

### **üî• Critical Failure Point**
The project **chose bash for a task requiring a proper templating engine**. The sophisticated template syntax they designed required:
- **Variable substitution**: `${persona.name}`
- **Loops**: `{% for step in sequence -%}`  
- **Conditionals**: `{% if persona_id == "analyst" %}`
- **Filters**: `${features | join(", ")}`

**Bash cannot handle this complexity** without becoming unmaintainable.

### **üîÑ The Right Approach Would Have Been**
1. **Python script** with Jinja2 templating
2. **Node.js script** with Handlebars/Mustache  
3. **Go template engine** for self-contained binary
4. **Even simple sed/awk** would have been more suitable than complex bash

---

## üí° **LESSONS LEARNED**

### **What Went Right**
- ‚úÖ **Excellent architectural vision** - Single source of truth concept
- ‚úÖ **Comprehensive specifications** - Very detailed JSON definitions  
- ‚úÖ **Pragmatic fallback** - Kept system working with manual templates

### **What Went Wrong**  
- ‚ùå **Wrong tool choice** - Bash for template processing
- ‚ùå **Over-engineering** - Too complex for immediate needs
- ‚ùå **No prototype** - Should have proven templating system first
- ‚ùå **No cleanup** - Left unused infrastructure in codebase

---

## üèÅ **FINAL VERDICT**

**The Generate Personas system represents a classic case of "perfect being the enemy of good."**

The original vision was **architecturally sound and well-designed**, but the implementation approach (bash + manual string processing) was **fundamentally inadequate** for the complexity requirements.

Rather than switching to appropriate tooling (Python/Node.js/Go), they made the **practical decision** to fall back to manual templates, keeping the system working while abandoning the sophisticated generation system.

**Result**: A working system with **19 unused JSON/template files** representing significant development effort that was never activated.

---

**Status**: ‚úÖ **Investigation Complete**

The Generate Personas system exists as an **architectural artifact** of an ambitious vision that was **technically sound but practically unimplemented** due to tooling limitations and time constraints.

there is only one real difference in requirements Between the Claude sub-agent template and the Coherence APM persona template, and that is the metadata at the top of the sub-agent template.

---
name: {persona.name}
description: {persona.description}
---

I Want to simplify the persona/subagent generation system significantly.
1. I have reorganized the files under @payload/personas/ 
- _build/generate_persona.sh (which is currently an empty script we will generate our installer script here)
- _master/ has all the agent templates we will maintain
- templates/claude.persona.template defines the templates for transforming a regular agent persona file (like the ones in _master) to a claude subagent file
2. Using the existing generate_personas script, create a script that will be used by the installer at install time, which takes each persona template located in _master, uses the claude.persona.template to create subagent markdown files according to the claude code requirements and places them in the proper directory .claude/agents/ at the target installer location.  It then takes the persona templates located in _master and uses them to create the persona templates in .apm/agents/personas
3. In the installer script, we should look for old directories that are now obsolete in the .claude/agents directory. These directories would include chaining, context, coordintation, documentation, dual-mode, implementation-sprint-coordination, migration, monitoring, qa-framework, sprint-coordination, user-guide, voice
4. In the isntaller script, we should look for old files that are now obsolete in the .claude/agents directory.  These files include parallel-execution-patterns, synthesis-patterns and task-coordination

The user is asking me to help simplify the persona/subagent generation system. Let me understand what they want:

1. They've reorganized files under @payload/personas/:
   - _build/generate_persona.sh (empty script to be filled)
   - _master/ has all the agent templates (currently .md.template files)  
   - templates/claude.persona.template defines the template for transforming regular agent personas to Claude subagent files

2. They want me to create a script that will:
   - Take each persona template in _master/
   - Use claude.persona.template to create subagent markdown files for Claude Code
   - Place them in .claude/agents/ at target install location
   - Also take the persona templates from _master/ and create persona templates in .apm/agents/personas/

3. The installer should clean up old obsolete directories in .claude/agents/: chaining, context, coordination, documentation, dual-mode, implementation-sprint-coordination, migration, monitoring, qa-framework, sprint-coordination, user-guide, voice

4. The installer should clean up old obsolete files in .claude/agents/: parallel-execution-patterns, synthesis-patterns, task-coordination

The key insight is that the only difference between Claude subagent templates and APM persona templates is the metadata header at the top:
```
---
name: {persona.name}
description: {persona.description}  
---
```

This is a much simpler approach than the complex JSON-based system they had before. Let me:

1. First examine the current _master/ directory to see what persona templates are there
2. Look at the claude.persona.template to understand the transformation needed
3. Create the generate_persona.sh script that does the transformation
4. Update the installer to use this new generation system and clean up old files

content.thinking:
Now I'll create the generate_persona.sh script. Based on my analysis:

1. The _master directory contains 9 persona .md.template files
2. The claude.persona.template is a simple wrapper that adds YAML frontmatter
3. The transformation needs to:
   - Extract the persona name from the "Role:" line
   - Extract a description (likely from the Role line too)  
   - Add the YAML header
   - Append the original content

Let me create the script:

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Simplified Persona Generation System for APM Installer
# Generates Claude subagent files and APM persona files from _master templates

set -euo pipefail

# Script configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PERSONAS_DIR="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
MASTER_DIR="$PERSONAS_DIR/_master"
TEMPLATE_DIR="$PERSONAS_DIR/_templates"
CLAUDE_TEMPLATE="$TEMPLATE_DIR/claude.persona.template"

# Target directories (passed as arguments or defaults)
TARGET_ROOT="${1:-/tmp/apm-install-test}"
CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR="$TARGET_ROOT/.claude/agents"
APM_OUTPUT_DIR="$TARGET_ROOT/.apm/agents/personas"

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'  
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Logging functions
log_info() { echo -e "${BLUE}‚Ñπ${NC} $*"; }
log_success() { echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ${NC} $*"; }
log_warning() { echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è${NC} $*"; }
log_error() { echo -e "${RED}‚ùå${NC} $*"; }

# Header
echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}   APM Simplified Persona Generation${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo ""

# Validate inputs
if [ ! -d "$MASTER_DIR" ]; then
    log_error "Master directory not found: $MASTER_DIR"
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -f "$CLAUDE_TEMPLATE" ]; then
    log_error "Claude template not found: $CLAUDE_TEMPLATE"
    exit 1
fi

# Create target directories
log_info "Creating target directories..."
mkdir -p "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR"
mkdir -p "$APM_OUTPUT_DIR"

# Extract persona name and description from template file
extract_persona_info() {
    local template_file="$1"
    local role_line=$(grep -m1 "^# Role:" "$template_file" || echo "")
    
    if [ -z "$role_line" ]; then
        echo "Unknown Agent|Generic Agent Description"
        return
    fi
    
    # Extract name and description from "# Role: Name - Description" or "# Role: Name"
    local full_role="${role_line#\# Role: }"
    
    if [[ "$full_role" == *" - "* ]]; then
        local name="${full_role%% - *}"
        local description="${full_role#* - }"
        echo "$name|$description"
    else
        echo "$full_role|$full_role"
    fi
}

# Generate Claude subagent file from master template
generate_claude_subagent() {
    local master_file="$1"
    local base_name=$(basename "$master_file" .md.template)
    local output_file="$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/${base_name}.md"
    
    log_info "Generating Claude subagent: ${base_name}.md"
    
    # Extract persona information
    local persona_info=$(extract_persona_info "$master_file")
    local persona_name="${persona_info%|*}"
    local persona_desc="${persona_info#*|}"
    
    # Generate the Claude subagent file
    {
        echo "---"
        echo "name: $persona_name"
        echo "description: $persona_desc"
        echo "---"
        echo ""
        cat "$master_file"
    } > "$output_file"
    
    log_success "Created: $output_file"
}

# Generate APM persona file from master template
generate_apm_persona() {
    local master_file="$1"
    local base_name=$(basename "$master_file" .md.template)
    local output_file="$APM_OUTPUT_DIR/${base_name}.md"
    
    log_info "Generating APM persona: ${base_name}.md"
    
    # For APM personas, we just copy the master file (removing .template extension)
    cp "$master_file" "$output_file"
    
    log_success "Created: $output_file"
}

# Clean up obsolete files and directories in Claude agents
cleanup_obsolete_claude_files() {
    log_info "Cleaning up obsolete Claude agents files..."
    
    # Obsolete directories to remove
    local obsolete_dirs=(
        "chaining"
        "context" 
        "coordination"
        "documentation"
        "dual-mode"
        "implementation-sprint-coordination"
        "migration"
        "monitoring"
        "qa-framework"
        "sprint-coordination"
        "user-guide"
        "voice"
    )
    
    # Obsolete files to remove
    local obsolete_files=(
        "parallel-execution-patterns.md"
        "synthesis-patterns.md"
        "task-coordination.md"
    )
    
    # Remove obsolete directories
    for dir in "${obsolete_dirs[@]}"; do
        if [ -d "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/$dir" ]; then
            log_warning "Removing obsolete directory: $dir"
            rm -rf "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/$dir"
        fi
    done
    
    # Remove obsolete files  
    for file in "${obsolete_files[@]}"; do
        if [ -f "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/$file" ]; then
            log_warning "Removing obsolete file: $file"
            rm -f "$CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR/$file"
        fi
    done
    
    log_success "Cleanup completed"
}

# Process all persona templates
log_info "Processing persona templates in: $MASTER_DIR"
processed_count=0

for template_file in "$MASTER_DIR"/*.md.template; do
    if [ ! -f "$template_file" ]; then
        continue
    fi
    
    base_name=$(basename "$template_file" .md.template)
    
    # Skip ap_orchestrator as it's a reference file
    if [ "$base_name" = "ap_orchestrator" ]; then
        log_warning "Skipping reference file: $base_name"
        continue
    fi
    
    echo ""
    log_info "Processing: $base_name"
    
    # Generate both Claude subagent and APM persona files
    generate_claude_subagent "$template_file"
    generate_apm_persona "$template_file"
    
    processed_count=$((processed_count + 1))
done

# Clean up obsolete files
echo ""
cleanup_obsolete_claude_files

# Summary
echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}          Generation Complete!${NC}" 
echo -e "${GREEN}‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Summary:"
echo "  - Templates processed: $processed_count"
echo "  - Claude subagents created in: $CLAUDE_OUTPUT_DIR"
echo "  - APM personas created in: $APM_OUTPUT_DIR"
echo "  - Obsolete files cleaned up"
echo ""
log_success "Simplified persona generation completed successfully!"

echo "‚úÖ APM commands installed/updated (including QA framework, test monitoring, documentation management, enhanced PO commands, and more)"

# Process persona templates
# NOTE: Personas are now processed via the bulk agents/ template processing above
# The separate templates/personas/ directory has been archived as it contained
# legacy versions. The templates/agents/personas/ directory contains the
# current, more advanced templates with native sub-agent architecture.
echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Persona templates processed via agents/ directory (native sub-agent architecture)"

# Process AP Orchestrator IDE templates
echo ""
echo "Processing Claude Sub-Agent templates..."
if [ -d "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/claude/agents" ]; then
    echo "‚è≥ Installing Claude Code sub-agent infrastructure..."
    
    # Create .claude/agents directory structure (only for actual agent personas)
    ensure_dir "$CLAUDE_DIR/agents"
    ensure_dir "$CLAUDE_DIR/agents/personas"
    
    # Process agent persona files (actual agents) to .claude/agents/
    if [ -d "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/claude/agents/personas" ]; then
        echo "‚è≥ Installing agent personas..."
        find "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/claude/agents/personas" -name "*.template" -type f | while read template_file; do
            # Calculate relative path from templates/claude/agents/personas
            rel_path="${template_file#$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/claude/agents/personas/}"
            
            # Remove .template extension
            output_path="${rel_path%.template}"
            
            # Create output file path in .claude/agents/personas/
            output_file="$CLAUDE_DIR/agents/personas/$output_path"
            
            # Ensure directory exists
            output_dir=$(dirname "$output_file")
            ensure_dir "$output_dir"
            
            # Process template
            replace_variables "$template_file" "$output_file"
        done
        echo "‚úÖ Agent personas installed to .claude/agents/personas/"
    fi
    
    echo "‚úÖ Claude sub-agent infrastructure installed (persona templates only - orphaned docs removed)"
else
    echo "‚úì Claude sub-agent templates not found - using standard APM installation"
fi

# Process Claude output-styles templates

# Function to generate agents directory from templates
generate_agents_from_templates() {
    echo "Processing template files..."
    
    # Find all template files and process them
    find "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents" -name "*.template" -type f | while read template_file; do
        # Calculate relative path from templates/agents
        rel_path="${template_file#$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents/}"
        
        # Remove .template extension
        rel_path="${rel_path%.template}"
        
        # Create output file path
        output_file="$AP_ROOT/$rel_path"
        
        # Create output directory
        mkdir -p "$(dirname "$output_file")"
        
        # Process template through replace_variables
        replace_variables "$template_file" "$output_file"
        
        echo "  Generated: $rel_path"
    done
    
    echo "‚úÖ Generated agents directory from templates"
}

                            cp "$file" "$AP_DOCS/" 2>/dev/null || true
                        fi
                    fi
                done
                echo "‚úÖ Processed agent documentation files to $AP_DOCS"
            else
                echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Skipping documentation copy - AP_DOCS path not set"
            fi
        fi

# Function to generate agents directory from templates
generate_agents_from_templates() {
    echo "Processing template files..."
    
    # Find all template files and process them
    find "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents" -name "*.template" -type f | while read template_file; do
        # Calculate relative path from templates/agents
        rel_path="${template_file#$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents/}"
        
        # Remove .template extension
        rel_path="${rel_path%.template}"
        
        # Create output file path
        output_file="$AP_ROOT/$rel_path"
        
        # Create output directory
        mkdir -p "$(dirname "$output_file")"
        
        # Process template through replace_variables
        replace_variables "$template_file" "$output_file"
        
        echo "  Generated: $rel_path"
    done
    
    echo "‚úÖ Generated agents directory from templates"
}
edits.new_string:
# Function to generate personas using simplified generation system
generate_personas_simplified() {
    echo "Processing persona templates using simplified generation system..."
    
    # Check if the simplified generation script exists
    local generation_script="$INSTALLER_DIR/personas/_build/generate_persona.sh"
    
    if [ -f "$generation_script" ]; then
        echo "‚è≥ Running simplified persona generation..."
        
        # Make script executable
        chmod +x "$generation_script"
        
        # Run the generation script with target directory
        "$generation_script" "$TARGET_DIR"
        
        echo "‚úÖ Simplified persona generation completed"
    else
        echo "‚ùå ERROR: Simplified generation script not found: $generation_script"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Function to generate other agents directory from templates (non-personas)
generate_agents_from_templates() {
    echo "Processing non-persona template files..."
    
    # Find all template files except personas and process them
    find "$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents" -name "*.template" -type f | while read template_file; do
        # Skip persona templates - they're handled by the simplified system
        if [[ "$template_file" == */personas/* ]]; then
            continue
        fi
        
        # Calculate relative path from templates/agents
        rel_path="${template_file#$INSTALLER_DIR/templates/agents/}"
        
        # Remove .template extension
        rel_path="${rel_path%.template}"
        
        # Create output file path
        output_file="$AP_ROOT/$rel_path"
        
        # Create output directory
        mkdir -p "$(dirname "$output_file")"
        
        # Process template through replace_variables
        replace_variables "$template_file" "$output_file"
        
        echo "  Generated: $rel_path"
    done
    
    echo "‚úÖ Generated non-persona agents directory from templates"
}
